content.description:
Steep lower half on good features and holds. Extension is clearly confused  too bad the cliff was not longer! 7 bolt 10b, or 8 bolt 5.11/11+ extn (lower biner w 4 quick links and 6
inch chain off 2 bolts w hangers)

Likely best and most sustained route at the crag. The 5.10 is really nice, and the extension is the icing on the cake 8 bolt 10c to 2 ring anchor; Even Odds 2 bolt 11b/c extn (rappel
station w 1 ring)

Good varied climbing, the first route at the crag.

8 bolts to ring anchors

Crux dyno is easier than it looks, with a top out that is harder than it looks. What a tall person gains is quickly taken back! The bolting should keep people honest.

7 bolt 10+/11- (to rappel anchor w 1 ring).....extn not yet complete

The cliff is located directly across from the Hideaway, and is a 5 minute walk up through the trees from the creek bed. A trail can be found on the east side of the creek (behind the large boulder in the trees) from where the Lookout trail heads up the other way (west). 
  
 The crag comes into the sun in the late afternoon (4-5pm depending on time of year) and is a nice compliment to the routes at the Hideaway. Good for a warm up/down from the Hideaway, chasing the sun or shade, or an after work session. 
  
 Most routes are 5.10 or easy 5.11 with a greater variety of easier climbing than most other crags currently in Echo Canyon. The clean grey rock is very solid and riddled with features. The crag is capped by a yellow roof with a few 
 token pockets and tufas. This keeps the crag reasonably dry during light rain. Most routes dry very quickly. 
  
 A standard set of quick draws and a 60m rope is all you need. Most routes are only ~20-25m high. 
  
 Trail and staging areas are a work in progress.
